marketNews.title: Car Sales for April 2024: -17.4% YoY; ASII Market Share Decreases
marketNews.content: Car wholesale sales in Indonesia in April 2024 were recorded at 48,637 units, a decrease of -34.8% Month over Month (MoM) and -17.4% Year over Year (YoY). This realization, although affected by the Eid al-Fitr effect, still indicates weaker sales compared to car sales during the Eid al-Fitr period since 2021. In our view, the FY24 target from the association (Gaikindo) of 1.1 million units is becoming increasingly difficult to achieve with weak realization until 4M24, which only reached 24% of the FY24 target. Meanwhile, for stock prices, the negative sentiment from weak automotive sales (down ~20% YoY) will continue to overshadow the stock price movements of automotive issuers such as ASII, AUTO, and DRMA, all of which have weakened since the beginning of the year. We assess that signs of bottoming out in car sales figures (e.g., from -20% YoY to approaching -10% YoY) are needed to see a recovery in stock prices.

marketNews.title: SSIA Raises Marketing Sales Target
marketNews.content: SSIA: VP Head of Investor Relations of Surya Semesta Internusa, Erlin Budiman, stated that management is increasing the marketing sales target for Suryacipta City of Industry Karawang and Subang Smartpolitan industrial land in 2024 from 65 ha to 184 ha. This revision was announced after BYD, an electric vehicle company from China, purchased 108 hectares of the company's land.

marketNews.title: Menkominfo states Starlink has secured an operating permit in Indonesia.
marketNews.content: Minister of Communication and Information Technology Budi Arie Setiadi stated that Starlink, Elon Musk's satellite company, has obtained a permit to operate in Indonesia as an internet service provider for retail consumers. Starlink will begin trials in the Nusantara Capital City (IKN) this month. Previously, Starlink had also obtained operating permits in Malaysia and the Philippines.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg reports US government plans to raise tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles.
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the US government plans to increase import tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles from 27.5% to 102.5%. Furthermore, tariffs on several products from other industries are also planned to increase two to three times. This policy is expected to be announced this week and is aimed at protecting US workers.

marketNews.title: President Joko Widodo sets deadline for the implementation of standard hospital care room standards (KRIS) in the JKN program.
marketNews.content: President Joko Widodo set the deadline for the implementation of standard hospital care room facilities (KRIS) in the National Health Insurance (JKN) program no later than June 30, 2025. This was established in Presidential Regulation of the Republic of Indonesia (Perpres) No. 59/2024 concerning the Third Amendment to Perpres No. 82/2028 concerning JKN.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Ceramic Industry Association (Asaki) states that almost all local ceramic producers are eyeing entry into IKN.
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Ceramic Industry Association (Asaki) stated that almost all local ceramic producers are eyeing entry into IKN. According to Edy Suyanto, Chairman of Asaki, several companies are in the exploration and offering stage as tile providers for a number of projects. Edy stated that ultimately IKN will almost certainly not use imported ceramic products due to TKDN regulations.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia and the Central Bank of the United Arab Emirates signed an MOU to enhance trade partnership.
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia (BI) and the Central Bank of the United Arab Emirates signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) to enhance trade partnership. One of the agreed points is the use of both countries' currencies for bilateral transactions.

tickerNews.title: Astra International (ASII) wholesale car sales declined in April 2024.
tickerNews.content: Meanwhile, Astra International (ASII) recorded car wholesale sales of 26,531 units in April 2024, a decrease of -34.2% MoM and -23.4% YoY. This relatively sharp decline was mainly driven by the largest brand, Toyota (-29.3% MoM, -30.3% YoY). Meanwhile, non-Astra car brands in April reached 22,106 units (-35.5% MoM, -8.9% YoY). The correction in non-Astra car sales was mainly triggered by a decline in Mitsubishi (-47.6% MoM, -52.7% YoY). In terms of market share in April, ASII experienced a decline to 54.5% (vs. Apr23: 58.8%) with Toyota's market share sharply decreasing to 31.2% (vs. Apr23: 37%). Meanwhile, Daihatsu increased to 19.5% (vs Apr23: 18.3%). On the non-Astra car side, Honda and Suzuki experienced an increase in market share, increasing to 9.5% and 10.3% respectively (vs. Apr23: Honda: 8.4%; Suzuki: 7.9%). Cumulatively during 4M24, car wholesale sales in Indonesia only reached 263,706 units (-22.6% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Surya Semesta Internusa (SSIA) raises marketing sales target for industrial land after BYD purchase.
tickerNews.content: $SSIA: VP Head of Investor Relations Surya Semesta Internusa, Erlin Budiman, stated that management is increasing the marketing sales target for Suryacipta City of Industry Karawang and Subang Smartpolitan industrial land in 2024 from 65 ha to 184 ha. This revision was announced after BYD, an electric vehicle company from China, purchased 108 hectares of the company's land.

tickerNews.title: Lippo Karawaci (LPKR) signs agreement to sell SILO shares worth ~IDR 3.8 trillion.
tickerNews.content: $LPKR: Lippo Karawaci through its subsidiary, PT Megapratama Karya Persada, has signed a conditional share sale agreement for 1.35 billion shares of Siloam International Hospital ($SILO) to Sight Investment Company Pte. Ltd. on May 13, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~3.8 trillion rupiah, implying a transaction price of 2,850 rupiah per share. Previously, Debtwire reported that a consortium led by CVC would acquire approximately 65% of SILO shares for US$1.6 billion.

tickerNews.title: Bank OCBC NISP (NISP) records double-digit net profit growth in Q1 2024.
tickerNews.content: $NISP: Bank OCBC NISP recorded net profit growth of +13% YoY in 1Q24 to 1.17 trillion rupiah. Net interest income rose +6% YoY while provision expenses dropped -96% YoY, attributed to improved asset quality following the recovery of economic activity. Credit disbursement increased by +11% YoY as of March 2024.

tickerNews.title: Summarecon Agung (SMRA) marketing sales for April 2024 reached IDR 284 billion.
tickerNews.content: $SMRA: Summarecon Agung recorded marketing sales of 284 billion rupiah (-33.1% MoM, -38.5% YoY) in April 2024. Cumulatively, marketing sales reached 1.1 trillion rupiah in 4M24 (-2.1% YoY), equivalent to 21.9% of the 2024 target of 5 trillion rupiah. This achievement was lower compared to the 4M23 achievement, which met 24.7% of the 2023 realization of 4.5 trillion rupiah. The landed house segment still dominates marketing sales with a contribution of 82.7%, followed by apartments (7.3%), land parcels (6.4%), and shophouses (3.3%).

tickerNews.title: Trans Power Marine (TPMA) announces changes in share ownership structure.
tickerNews.content: $TPMA: Trans Power Marine announced a change in the share ownership structure where Standard Chartered's ownership, which previously held 178.7 million (6.79%) shares in April 2024, completely transferred to 2 companies: 1) PT Artha Wijaya Kapital amounting to 100 million (3.80%) shares and 2) PT Investasi Jaya Cemerlang amounting to 78.7 million (2.99%) shares. PT Artha Wijaya Kapital bought all its shares from Empadora Assets Limited with a transaction value reaching 67.96 billion rupiah on April 25-26, 2024, April 29, 2024, and May 2, 2024. On the other hand, PT Investasi Jaya Cemerlang bought all its shares from Focalpoint Securities Limited with a transaction value reaching 53.4 billion rupiah on April 26, 2024, April 29-30, 2024, and May 3, 2024.
